title: Applicants in Canada: Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) exemption code A70 (International Mobility Program)
manual: Applicants in Canada: Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) exemption code A70 (International Mobility Program)
heading_path: Applicants in Canada: Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) exemption code A70 (International Mobility Program)
text:
Published Time: Wed, 11 Feb 2026 22:00:30 GMT

Applicants in Canada: Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) exemption code A70 (International Mobility Program)
================================================================================================================

This section contains policy, procedures and guidance used by IRCC staff. It is posted on the department’s website as a courtesy to stakeholders.

[Section 207](http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/SOR-2002-227/section-207.html) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations(IRPR) applies to applicants who have been determined eligible as members of certain in-Canada permanent residence classes and includes protected persons, whether or not they have applied for permanent resident status.

Open work permits may be issued.

See [Who must submit to an immigration medical exam?](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/standard-requirements/medical-requirements/exam/who-must-submit-immigration-medical-examination.html) for more details.

Labour Market Impact Assessment(LMIA) exemption code A70
--------------------------------------------------------

This exemption applies to the following:

* members of the live-in caregiver class who have met the requirements for permanent residence outlined in [section R113](http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/SOR-2002-227/section-113.html)
* members of the spouse or common-law partner class who have satisfied an officer that they meet the requirements of [section R124](http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/SOR-2002-227/section-124.html)
* persons upon whom protection has been conferred in accordance with [subsection 95(2)](http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/I-2.5/section-95.html) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act(IRPA), for example, Convention refugees, successful pre-removal risk assessment(PRRA) applicants
* people who have applied to become permanent residents and to whom the Minister has granted an exemption for humanitarian and compassionate considerations, upon request of the foreign national, under [subsection A25(1)](http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/I-2.5/section-25.html); on the Minister’s own initiative under [subsection A25.1(1)](https://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/I-2.5/section-25.1.html); or for public policy considerations under [subsection A25.2(1)](https://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/I-2.5/section-25.2.html)
 * For caregivers who meet this criteria, see [Open work permits for applicants under the Interim Pathway for Caregivers](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/special-initiatives-pilot-project/permits-for-interim-pathway.html).

* family members of the above who are in Canada

Page details
------------

 2019-07-11
